jsondiscoverer

Class JsonComposer

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsondiscoverer.JsonComposer

  • public class JsonComposer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class composes a set of ecore models representing JSON-based apis.

    Although some of the calculations done here could be applied in a more-general process of composing any ecore model, the current implementation is coupled to the data/structure of the ecore models discovered by the JsonAdvancedDiscoverer.

    In the context of the JSON discoverer, the JsonComposer is used to discover the metamodel out of a set of JSON-based APIs

    Author:
    Javier Canovas (me@jlcanovas.es)

    • Field Detail

      • sourceSets

        private java.util.List<JsonSourceSet> sourceSets
        The set of JsonSourceSets to use in the discovery process

      • LOGGER

        private static final java.util.logging.Logger LOGGER
        Used to log all the activity

      • ATTRIBUTE_MATCHING_THRESHOLD

        private static final double ATTRIBUTE_MATCHING_THRESHOLD
        Threshold to consider when two attributes.

        To calculate the ratio, the number of matching attributes in the two metamodel classes are compared. Thus, two metamodel classes with matching attributes will give a ratio of 1

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLASS_MATCHING_THRESHOLD

        private static final double CLASS_MATCHING_THRESHOLD
        Threshold to consider when two metamodel classes are similar.

        To calculate the ratio, the number of matching attributes/refereces in the two metamodel classes are compared. Thus, two metamodel classes with matching attributes/references will give a ratio of 1

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isSimilar

        private boolean isSimilar(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EClass sourceEClass,
                          org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EClass targetEClass)
        Compares if two metamodel classes (as EClass elements) are similar.

        The comparison takes into consideration the names of attributes/refrences and counts the ones that are similar. The ratio of similar vs. different is calculated and if it higher that ATTRIBUTE_MATCHING_THRESHOLD, the two classes are considered similar

        Parameters:
        sourceEClass - The source EClass
        targetEClass - The target EClass
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating if both classes are similar

      • nameIsSimilar

        private boolean nameIsSimilar(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sourceNames,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> targetNames)
        Compares two list of String and returns true when two similar Strings are found.
        Parameters:
        sourceNames - Source list of String
        targetNames - Target list of String
        Returns:
        True if at least two equal Strings (one in each list) are found.
